intro: Pimpinella sintenisii var. cinerea, commonly known as the gray pimpinella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its hairy, grayish foliage gives it a distinctive appearance and helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat.
